text: What's up outliers? I want to talk to you about a trade in CCJ where I used unusual options activity in conjunction with a thematic idea to effectively make over 200 return on the option itself. And it was about 160 return on a VESA capital so far, the trade's not fully over yet. So I'm going to talk to you about what the idea was, how I found it, those kinds of things. And I want to start by setting the table with you all. And this is the position we're going to be talking about. The first thing to know is that I've scaled this position so that it's similar sizing in my actual portfolio, but using the 600,000 model portfolio. I'm trying to put everything in a common language. So effectively what this is is essentially saying, if this trade was part of this portfolio, this would be the relative sizing used, which ended up being 12,600 position for 50 lots. This represents about a 2 position, which in my actual portfolio, this trade was larger, but this is the same relative size. So that is we talk about the model portfolio and stuff like that, all of this carries over. Because the actual dollars amounts, it none of it matters. I know that it's fun for like gain porn and seeing numbers, but I care so much more about talking about the process. So I think it's useful to keep everything in that context. So let's start with the broader theme. And let's listen to a few seconds of this. This is from a few months ago. From President-elect Donald Trump, that he wants to drill baby drill, but it's unclear if oil executives actually want to increase production while President-elect Trump has said that he wants to gut the inflation reduction act. So nuclear could actually be the biggest energy beneficiary for a few reasons. First of all, so you heard it, and I think this is actually a pretty decent summary. The positioning for nuclear power is very strong. So it put it on a watch list for me. And it's something that I knew that we were going to see policy eventually announced around. And when we would see that policy, there likely was going to be a interesting change in price. So we're going to talk about this trade in the context of the outlier trade process. And I will throw a link to this video in the notes below. But this is effectively the major steps I go through mentally as I'm putting on a trade.

I wasn't expecting to realize that full 2 loss if I started seeing not accommodating price behavior, but that is what I was prepared to lose based on the trade. The reason why I always take the time to define risk, whether it's going to be by size or by a hard stop, is because it allows me to then plan successfully for the rest of the trade.
